thread.title: Jose Mourinho says Manchester United fans will camp outside Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s house to make sure he signs new deal
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho says Manchester United fans will camp outside Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s house to make sure he signs new deal

author: smorgan
title: Jose Mourinho says Manchester United fans will camp outside Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s house to make sure he signs new deal

organizations.name: news group newspapers ltd manchester united

text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JOSE MOURINHO says Manchester United fans will camp outside Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s house in order to make sure he signs a new deal. 
The 35-year-old striker was sensational in United’s 3-2 EFL Cup final win over Southampton at Wembley yesterday. News Group Newspapers Ltd Jose Mourinho is desperate or Zlatan Ibrahimovic to stay at Man United PA:Press Association Jose Mourinho says Old Trafford supporters can go outside Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s house 
But he is yet to put pen to paper on a new deal at Old Trafford. 
And though Mourinho stopped short of pleading with Ibrahimovic to do so, he said United supporters can show how much the Swede means to the club by setting up camp outside his home. 
Mourinho said: “I never beg a player to play for me, but we all want and believe he will stay one more season. 
“I never beg for a player to sign a contract. But, if needed, the fans can go to the door of his house and stay there all night.” News Group Newspapers Ltd Manchester United bosses will be desperate to hold onto the goalscoring machine EPA Zlatan Ibrahimovic has more than proved his worth to Manchester United Did Zlatan Ibrahimovic troll Arsenal after Man Utd EFL Cup win? 
SunSport told you in January how United bosses wanted Ibrahimovic to stay for another TWO years . 
The original contract he signed had an option for a further season - but chiefs want him to stay until he is 37. 
Ibrahimovic collected the 32nd trophy of his incredible career after heading in an 87th-minute winner against Claude Puel's valiant side. Mourinho says the Manchester United fans would camp at Ibrahimovic's house Related stories Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp insists player power was NOT to blame for Claudio Ranieri sacking rest assured Antonio Conte out to create Chelsea dynasty and wants to open restaurant with brother in London FOOTBALL ON TV What football is on TV today? Our guide to this week's live matches Jin the money Tianjin Quanjian owner confirms bid for Diego Costa and admits there is ‘no limit’ to CSL side’s budget Barking mad Refs' ruling body picks Huddersfield fan Robert Madley to officiate promotion rivals Brighton vs Newcastle Kit's mad Spanish side forced to play league match in white T-shirts with hand-written numbers after double kit clash Foxes Hiddink SOS Guus Hiddink willing to consider taking over relegation battlers Leicester only until the end of the seaon CARLO'S WAY Ronaldinho, Alonso and Casillas are out — but who is in Carlo Ancelotti's all-time XI? BILLY'S BATTLE Celtic legend Billy McNeill is battling dementia and has lost power of speech.. but his face still lights up at Parkhead Expensive Bhoy Dembele is good enough to play for Real Madrid… but he will cost £50m, according to Cristian Gamboa at a boy Manchester United scouts watch Franck Kessie and Elseid Hysaj during Serie A clash between Napoli and Atalanta Zo close Tighest-ever goal-line decision all but crowns Feyenoord champions after amazing keeper error 
And the man who arrived from Paris Saint-Germain on a free in the summer appeared to take a pop at Arsenal after collecting his latest silverware. 
He said: "We are winning. After seven months I have two trophies with this club. 
"There are other clubs that didn't win for ten years. I've won what they won in ten years, so I'm happy with that." 
And, of course, Ibrahimovic made clear he had predicted his success all along , silencing the doubters. 
He added: "This is what I predicted. Everything I thought would happen, has. 
"The others didn't see it. Apparently, to many, I could not do it. I keep doing what I am doing every year."
